intro: Hapalostephium paludosum, commonly known as the swamp rush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in eastern North America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and rushes, and typically grows in marshy or swampy areas. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often overlooked due to their inconspicuous appearance. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and colonize wetland habitats effectively. Hapalostephium paludosum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wetland organisms.
